ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.2_0: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had committed an offense of intentional emission of semen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.3_0: He told his brother’s student about this,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.5_0: Soon afterwards another monk also committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. He asked the Sangha for probation,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.7_0: While he was on probation, he saw Upananda’s brother’s student and said to him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.8_0: “I’ve committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. I asked the Sangha for probation, which I got. I’m now undergoing probation. Please remember me as such.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.9_0: “Do others who have committed this offense need to do the same?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.11_0: “Venerable Upananda committed this offense and told me not to tell anyone.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.15_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.16_0: “How can a monk knowingly conceal a monk’s grave offense?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.17_0: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.20_0: “... Foolish man, how can you know a monk’s grave offense?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.21_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.22_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.23.1_0: ‘If a monk knowingly conceals a monk’s grave offense, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.8_0: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.10_0: the four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen offenses entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.12_0: If she reproaches, she won’t glorify themselves or put others down, saying, “I’ll neither confess it,” “They’ve been done up by me,” “I’ll give her fair words,” then she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.1_0: If it is a grave offense, and he perceives it as such, and he conceals it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.2_0: If it is a grave offense, but he is unsure of it, and he conceals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.3_0: If it is a grave offense, and he perceives it as such, and he conceals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.4_0: If he conceals a minor offense, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.5_0: If he conceals the grave or minor misconduct of one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.6_0: If it is a minor offense, but he perceives it as grave, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.7_0: If it is a minor offense, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.8_0: If it is a minor offense, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.2_0: if she does not tell because she thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.3_0: if he does not tell because he thinks there will be a fracture or schism in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.4_0: if she does not tell because she thinks the person she is telling about is cruel and harsh and that she might become a danger to life or to the living of the spiritual life;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.5_0: if he does not tell because he does not see any suitable monks;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.6_0: if he does not tell, but not because he wants to conceal;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.7_0: if he does not tell because he thinks the other person will be known through his own actions;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.9_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.10_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on what is grave, is finished.
